body:
I'm confused that it would be trying `admin_template_path`... Do you have a `Template` model?

I assume the previous behavior, where you create a comment for an `Order` but it redirects you to `StockerOrder`, wasn't desired?

When you say 0.6.0 do you mean the official Gem release, or the newer code on GitHub? What version did you upgrade from?

@Daxter thanks for the comment. Let me clarify your questions.

I don't have a `Template` model and the previous behaviour was not desired. The version I use is the official Gem release.

I think `redirect_to :back` would be a good solution for this issue. Is there a way I can override the default behaviour of before_filter in `lib/active_admin/comments.rb`? I'm thinking of doing some quick get around for this.
Did you figure this out? I still have no idea how or why `admin_template_path` was called.

I sort of sorted it out, but haven't really fixed it yet :)

What I assume is: After a comment has created, it redirects to the comment's show action but its before_filter tries to redirect to the comment's parent resource (in `lib/comments.rb`). When you have another aliased resource registered, `resource_for(comment.resource.class)` doesn't return the original resource but aliased (maybe later registered) resource. In my case when I create a comment on an Order, it actually tries to redirect to a ShippedOrder resource which is not available for the moment because ShippedOrder is scoped with a :shipped state.

Any advice?

One thing I was wrong was that I do have a Template resource defined in the development env, but not committed to my repository/production env and Template is an alias of Order model as well. Sorry for any confusing.

However it does prove that `active_admin_config.namespace.resource_for(comment.resource.class)` returns a resource that is firstly defined/registered for the given class.

Is it a valid idea that `ActiveAdmin::RecourceCollection.find_by_resource_class` to skip/ignore aliased resource (which have @as) when returning to prevent this error?

What version of AA are you using? Can you try using the latest code on GitHub?

``` ruby
gem 'activeadmin', github: 'gregbell/active_admin'
```

6c2a9886427e3a481d0d727316d524e075f63af5 changes the code to call `resource.resource` instead of `comments.resource`

Also note that on master, `ResourceCollection` has changed [quite a lot](https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/blob/f35c2ec31d5d58f1317d11a5cb432cfa1ee6d2fa/lib/active_admin/resource_collection.rb)

But to answer your question, the `:as` option is used to create an `ActiveAdmin::Resource::Name` to represent that resource inside the Resource Collection.

It doesn't look like there's a clean way to query the Resource Collection for these renamed resources though...

``` ruby
# Given this registration:
ActiveAdmin.register Category, as: 'Foo'

# The Resource Collection includes this:
{ Resource::Name.new(...) => Resource.new(...) }

ActiveAdmin.application.namespaces[:admin].resources.keys
# => [User, Foo, Dashboard]
```

Theoretically you should be able to access it just like any hash, but neither of these work:

``` ruby
ActiveAdmin.application.namespaces[:admin].resources['Foo']
ActiveAdmin.application.namespaces[:admin].resources[Resource::Name.new(Category,'Foo')]
```

@Daxter Thanks for the info. I'll try the latest code.

I sort of get around it as my colleagues are suffering from the error (Every time they leave a new comment, they have to go back and refresh the page). What I'm doing is defining a show method for the resource that `resource_for` returns and the method simply redirect to the desired resource.

```
controller do
  def show
    o = Order.find(params[:id])
    redirect_to admin_order_path(o) and return
  end
end
```

I know this is not ideal, but it helps ;)

UPDATE : I found that the above issue has already been reported https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/issues/2306

@Daxter Hello, I'm having some issues trying the master code.

I registered Order twice like:
`ActiveAdmin.register Order do ...`
`ActiveAdmin.register Order, as: 'UnshippedOrder' do ...`

/admin/orders now throws
`No route matches [GET] "/admin/orders"`
`rake routes` doesn't show any paths related to the resource.

and /admin/unshipped_orders throws
`wrong number of arguments (2 for 1)` in line 213 of `lib/active_admin/resource_controller/data_access.rb`.

```
      def apply_authorization_scope(collection)
        action_name = action_to_permission(params[:action])
        active_admin_authorization.scope_collection(collection, action_name)
      end
```

Has ActiveAdmin.register syntax changed? I'm sorry that it's not the best place for the questions, but there's not info about it on the master's docs.

@baxang, #2306 has now been fixed on master.

Sorry, I haven't touched this issue in a while. Does this problem still occur on master?
Hmm, yeah I just confirmed this is still occurring.
@baxang this has now been fixed on master
